subject: Data
title: Chartjunk: When Decoration Kills Data
description: A fast breakdown of Chartjunk: When Decoration Kills Data for builders.

hook.text: A 3D exploding pie chart with shadow effects and clip art makes the data nearly impossible to read.

buildup.text: Chartjunk is any visual element that doesn't help you understand the data â€” gradients, borders, gridlines.

discovery.text: Tufte showed that removing chartjunk improves comprehension by up to 50% in controlled experiments.

twist.text: Yet PowerPoint templates still default to 3D effects, shadows, and decorative elements.

climax.text: The best charts are the simplest. Every pixel should either inform or get out of the way.

punchline.text: If it doesn't help you understand, delete it.

quiz.question: What is 'chartjunk'?
options: Decorative elements that don't help comprehension
